moreHelp.tryRecovery: If you installed the driver and the calculator has a black screen (or the upsilon crash screen), you can try recovering it by pressing the 6 and reset (at the back of the calculator) keys at the same time and then pressing the recovery button.

installer.incompatibleBrowser:
It looks like your browser doesn't support webUSB therefore, you will not be able to install Upsilon from this browser. 
 Please use a chromium-based browser (chrome, brave etc...)

beta.title: Beta
beta.description: More stable than dev, updated every 1-2 weeks. Use this if you want to select a theme

dev.title: Dev
dev.description: Most up-to-date build, updated at every single change

e16.message: This usually happens when you updated your calculator to Epsilon 16 or later, which locks up the calculator.
e16.beforeLink: To unlock you calculator, take a look at

tError.text: Make sure you don't disconnect your device during the transfer! If you didn't disconnect your device you can try following things:

installer.unknownModelConnected: Warning: Could not detect the calculator model. This either means that you have Epsilon 16 or later installed, in which case you need to unlock your calculator (see FAQ) or you have an operating system with a bootloader installer on your calculator. In this case the installer will install the OS but will not be able to update/remove the bootloader. If you want to update the bootloader or install Upsilon without it (the Don't use slots option) press reset at the back of your calculator and the 6 key at the same time and click on recovery.
installer.unknownModelDone: Done. You can now reset your calculator manually for the changes to take effect.

reader.name: Reader
reader.description: A reader app with support for LaTeX special characters

external.name: External apps
external.description: Install community apps on the fly with External. Also includes KhiCAS and various emulators.

symbolic.name: Symbolic calculation
symbolic.description: Symbolic computation was removed from Epsilon in version 11.2. Omega reintroduces that feature.

themes.name: Themes engine
themes.description: Customize the look of your calculator with one of the following themes
themes.andmanymore: Or one of the community made themes

periodic.name: Periodic table
periodic.description: Inspired by the TI83PCE's periodic table app, Omega's periodic table is clean and simple to use.

rpn.name: RPN
rpn.description: Omega supports using Reverse Polish Notation to do calculations. This lets you first input all the numbers and then combine them using mathematical operations.

3ds.name: 3DS simulator
3ds.description: Omega is available and fully usable on the Nintendo 3DS.

protection.title: Protection against E16
protection.content: Updating to Epsilon 16+ locks your calculator down preventing you from installing you any unofficial firmware. This protection prevents from unintentional updates

python.title: Python improvements
python.ulab: Added Ulab which contains SciPy and NumPy (N110 only)
python.battery: Added a way to get the battery level (level, voltage and charging status)

dualboot.description: Omega integrates a new Bootloader. It allows you to boot multiple OS from different slots.
dualboot.name: Dual boot

phi.description: Phi is a tool developed by M4x1m3 that unlocks your calculator after an Epsilon 16+ update.
phi.name: Phi

plenty.name: Plenty of other smaller features
plenty.description: You can find a detailed list there:

settings.name: More settings
settings.description: Customize your calculator's behaviour to your heart's content

latex.description: In the reader app, you can read a txt file. You can also read a txt file with LaTeX expression inside of it.
latex.symbolslisted: For a LaTeX expression to be rendered, you need to surround it with dollar signs. All the symbols you can use are listed here :

definition.p1: is another way of writing mathematical calculations. It was invented by the polish mathematician Jan ≈Åukasiewicz in 1924.
definition.p2: This notation provides several advantages : RPN calculators are based on the use of a stack, the operands are placed on top of the stack, while the results of the calculations are also returned on top of the stack. Although this might be disconcerting at first, one quickly realizes that it helps make mathematical expressions easier to understand and manipulate.

rpn.h2: Quick introduction to the RPN app on Upsilon

introduction.p1: When you want to do a calculation in the RPN app on Upsilon, you must start by writing all the numbers that will be involved in your expression in order of appearance. Then you press the appropriate operand also in order of apparition.
introduction.p2: You can change the position of a term in the stack by using the parenthesis button, which will move it up or down.

note.content: throughout the whole Omega history, a bug made the RPN app hard to safely use on the calculator, however, thanks to RedGlow, dl11 and Overengined, the bug was fixed, and it is now totally safe to use the RPN app.
note.title: Note:

themes.title: List of themes
themes.description: All of these themes can be installed with the online installer

reader.name: The reader app
reader.p1: The reader app can read .txt files that you can upload to your calculator via
reader.p2: But it also supports the custom .urt format, which stands for Upsilon Rich Text. It allows you to use colors and supports a subset of the LaTeX special characters and functions.
reader.colorsDesc: You can change the color of the text using the following color codes. The text that follows a color code will be in the corresponding color.

example.title: Example
example.content: The following input produces the following output:

1-0.KandinskyEnhancements: Python: Kandinsky Enhancements (drawcircle, fillcircle, fillpolygon, getpalette)
1-0.Ulab: Python: Added Ulab in N110 (SciPy, NumPy)
1-0.PythonBattery: Python: Added a way to get the battery level (level, voltage and charging status)
1-0.PythonSettingsAutocomplete: Added a Python settings for autocompletion
1-0.SecondDegreePolynominal: Added additional output about second degree polynomials
1-0.VariableLoadedPythonToolbox: Increased number of loaded variables in Python toolbox
1-0.StorageSize: Increased size of Python script storage from 32KB to 64KB
1-0.BatteryPercentage: Show percentage of battery in about menu of settings
1-0.E16Security: Added deactivatable security to prevent Epsilon 16 unintentional updates
1-0.latex: Support of LaTex expressions and symbols in the Reader app.
1-0.backlightSettings: Added Settings for when the backlight should turn off
1-0.batteryPercentage: Display the battery percentage in the settings menu
1-0.cursor: Added a setting to save the cursor position in python files
1-0.PythonSettingsHighlight: Added a setting to disable Syntax highlighting

notFound.title: Bruh
notFound.underTitle: That page does not exist mate

supportedBrowsers.question: On which browsers does the installation work?
supportedBrowsers.answer: Any chromium-based browser that is not too old should work (Chrome, Brave, Edge etc...) Firefox will not work.

supportedModels.question: On which numworks models can I install Upsilon?
supportedModels.answer: You can install it on the N100 and N110 (if you don't have Epsilon 16+ installed)

how2backup.question: How to backup the calculator's data?
how2backup.answer: The installer should automatically restore scripts at the end of the installation. You can also go to bit.ly/upsiBackup to back them up manually.

how2external.question: How to install external apps?
how2external.answer: Go to the link provided in the homepage or after the installation and select the apps you want to install and then click install.

how2reader.question: How to use the reader app?
how2reader.answer: Go to the external files and add either .txt or .urt (Upsilon rich text) file. For more info please go to the reader tutorial.

how2py.question: How to transfer scripts to the calculator/edit scripts online without going to numworks.com?
how2py.answer: You can use the Omega IDE to do that, although at the simulator runs Omega and not Upsilon and at the moment there are problems with file transfers (which will also occur on numworks.com).

how2themes.question: How to install themes?
how2themes.answer: Go to the installer, select the beta channel and select your theme. You have to reinstall Upsilon to change the theme.

how2contribute.question: How to contribute to Upsilon/it's website?
how2contribute.answer: Contributions (bug reports, feature requests and commits) are very welcome on both Upsilon itself and it's website. You can request features and report bugs on their respective repository issue trackers: Upsilon and Upsilon-website

how2createReaderFile.question: How to create a file for the reader app from the calculator?
how2createReaderFile.answer: You can't. To add a reader file to the calculator, you have to go to the external apps page and transfer you files there.

how2testReaderOnline.question: How to preview a reader file online?
how2testReaderOnline.answer: You can't. You can do it with the windows/linux simulators by placing the reader files in the same directory as the executables or transfer the reader files to the calculator.

canRollback.question: Can you roll back from Upsilon to epsilon?
canRollback.answer: Yes, Just go to numworks.com, disable the protection against epsilon (Settings -> USB) and install epsilon normally. Alternatively, if you don't want to lock your calculator you can go there

how2recovery.question: What is the recovery option on the installer page and how do I use it?
how2recovery.answer: This can be used when the software on the calculator is broken. This usually happens when there is an error during the installation or when the calculator is disconnected during the installation. Press the 6 key and the reset key at the back of the calculator at the same time (make sure your calculator is connected to the computer via usb) and then press recovery. Select STM32 BOOTLOADER and after a few moments you should be able to install Upsilon normally.

cheatsheet.question: Is there a cheatsheet with the simulator's keyboard shortcuts/tips and tricks for Upsilon?
cheatsheet.answer: Not for now but maybe some day who knows ^^

numLocked.question: What can I do if I installed Epsilon 16+ on my calculator?
numLocked.answer: There is a guide explaining how to unlock your calculator

uninstallExternal.question: How to uninstall external apps?
uninstallExternal.answer: Go to the external apps page and select nothing and then install. This will erase all the external apps and background.

customTheme.question: How to create custom themes?
customTheme.answer: There is a theme maker app which makes it pretty easy to make themes.

stillCouldntFind.question: Couldn't find an answer to your question?
stillCouldntFind.answer: Go to the Omega community discord server and ask there!
